Entries.default: You're examining cargo in the hold when the sound of whispers and muted laughter draws you deeper into the darkness.

"Hylea's feathered tits!" [Specified 0] takes a step back, palms open. "Sorry! I didn't think anyone would be down here. Least of all you, captain."

With less-than-impressive subtlety, [Specified 1] pockets a second dagger.

You carefully round a stack of crates to find [Specified 0] and [Specified 1] engaged in a round of Orlan's Head.

[Specified 0] salutes. "Hello, captain. We're putting down copper on Orlan's Head, if you're looking to join for a round."
"What's Orlan's Head?"
"Sure, I can play a round."
"Stop this nonsense and go make yourselves useful."
"Maybe next time."

"You carve an orlan into the mast like so." [Specified 1] grins, gesturing at a crudely rendered figure with comically large ears and a rabbit nose. "Then you throw daggers at it. Each part is worth a different number points on account of some being harder to hit than others. The nose, for example, is worth lots of points!"
"Fantastic!" [Specified 1] takes a step back. "I'll sit this one out. I don't like losing coin."
"What's going on here?"
"Whatever. Just don't put a dagger through anything we might want to sell later."
As you make your way back through the hold, the sound of daggers thudding into wood resumes.

[Specified 0] swallows. "Orlan's Head, captain." 

[Specified 1] chuckles with open palms. "It's just a name. You can join in if you want to have a throw!"
[Specified 0] chuckles, produces a dagger, and spends an unnecessary length of time aiming the shot before loosing it at the "orlan."

[Specified 1] blanches as [Specified 0] snaps to attention. "Yes, captain!" they stammer, not quite as one.

"Apologies, captain." [Specified 0] bows. "We didn't mean any harm. We'll go get mess started."

The pair hastily retreat.
The dagger sinks into the orlan's [OrlansHeadGame_OpponentLastResult], and [Specified 1] chuckles. "Thatâ€™s [OrlansHeadGame_OpponentLastScore] points for [Specified 0], captain. Can you top that?"
[Take aim at the "orlan's" ears.]
[Try to land one in the "orlan's" nose.]

You let the dagger fly and, with a heavy thump, lodge it into the orlan's [OrlansHeadGame_PlayerLastResult].

"A hit, captain! That's [OrlansHeadGame_PlayerLastScore] points for you!"

"Mayhaps we might be throwing the daggers at the hands instead."

Serafen crosses his arms.

"Hope that weren't for me, cap. There really be worse ways a sailor can while away the time than practicing their throw."

Serafen watches them go.

[Specified 0] cants their head.

"But the carving doesn't have hands."

[Specified 1] rubs their palms together. "The final score is [OrlansHeadGame_OpponentTotalScore] for [Specified 0], and [OrlansHeadGame_PlayerTotalScore] for the captain. Looks like our captain's the winner!"
[Specified 1] claps [Specified 0] on the shoulder. "That's game! The captain earned [OrlansHeadGame_PlayerTotalScore] points, but [Specified 0] here racked up [OrlansHeadGame_OpponentTotalScore]!"
[Specified 1] grins, clapping."The score's tied at [OrlansHeadGame_PlayerTotalScore]. The next throw's winner takes it all!"
[Specified 0] retrieves the dagger, wiping the blade on a pants leg before passing the weapon to you, handle first. "Your turn, captain. Let's see how you fare against the dreaded orlan."
[Specified 0] chuckles, shaking their head, and passes over the purse. "Thanks for the game, captain. I'll get you next time, mark my words. For now, we'll get back to our duties."
"Sure, I can play a round."
"Sure, I can play a round."
"Sure, I can play a round."
"Are you idiots trying to kill someone?"
[Walk away.]
"Understood, sir!" [Specified 0] salutes. "We'll be careful."

[Specified 0] rubs the back of their head. "We were just playing a round of Orla-"

[Specified 1] interrupts them with a quick elbow to the ribs.

"Oof!"
"A round of what?"

"Aye, the time-honored maritime tradition of bigoted idiocy."

Serafen rubs the bridge of his nose.
The dagger sticks into the mast but entirely misses the orlan. [Specified 0] buries their face in their hands while [Specified 1] laughs raucously. "That shouldn't be hard to beat!"
"No offense, of course."
[Attempt to cheat.]
The pair of crew don't seem to notice your deceptive move.

"Come on, captain!" grouses [Specified 1]. "It's a friendly game! No need to cheat. You already have the heaviest purse aboard."

The sailor sighs and tosses you your coins.

"Here you go, then. [Specified 0] and I should get back to our duties." 

The pair meander off, scowling.
[Specified 1] winces. "Oh, captain, you know you're aiming for the orlan, right? At least you hit the mast."
[Specified 0] smiles and collects the purse. "Better luck next time, captain! We'll be getting back to duty now."
You step forward, shifting your body to lean a tad closer to the target than is technically legal, and let your dagger fly.
"Hands as in deckhands, as in you, you fathom-addled barnacle-arse!" Serafen sighs.

"...oh. We're far too large to make good targets, Serafen."

[Specified 0] shrugs, then looks to [Specified 1].

"Could be showing better sense in their choice of targets though."

He smirks.
You step forward, shifting your body to lean a tad closer to the target than is technically legal, and let your dagger fly.
You step forward, shifting your body to lean a tad closer to the target than is technically legal, and let your dagger fly.
You step forward, shifting your body to lean a tad closer to the target than is technically legal, and let your dagger fly.
You peer around a crate just as a dagger whips by, embedding itself in a crate behind you.
